tool.name: Liftover_via_SNP
tool.description: Lift a large chromosome region flanked by 2 SNPs from one genome to another
tool.command: mkdir tmpdir && printf "$chr:`expr $snp1 - $flank`-`expr $snp1 + $flank`\n" > tmpdir/regionlist && printf "$chr:`expr $snp2 - $flank`-`expr $snp2 + $flank`" >> tmpdir/regionlist && /home/galaxy/file_volume/samtools-1.10/samtools faidx --continue --region-file tmpdir/regionlist '$sgenome.fields.path' --output tmpdir/fa1 && cp tmpdir/fa1 $query && blat '$tgenome.fields.path' tmpdir/fa1 -maxIntron='$maxIntron' -tileSize='$tile' -out=psl '$output' && rm -rf tmpdir

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected genome

param.name: chr
param.label: Chromosome name of source genome
param.help: Which chromosome are the SNPs located. Must be present in the source genome. Example: Chr1, Chr2, Chr12 for Nipponbare, Chr01, Chr02, Chr10 for the 3 other genomes

param.name: snp1
param.label: Base position of left SNP in source genome
param.help: Integer value MUST BE WITHIN bounds of chromosome in source genome

param.name: snp2
param.label: Base position of right SNP in source genome
param.help: Integer value MUST BE WITHIN bounds of chromosome in source genome

param.name: flank
param.label: size of flanking sequence to either side of SNP
param.help: Determines the size of the sequence surrounding a SNP in the source genome to align to the target genome. Adjust to get a realistic hit in the target genome.

param.name: tgenome
param.label: Select target rice genome to lift-over

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected genome

param.name: tile
param.label: size of match that triggers an alignment(between 8 - 12 allowed)

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Liftover_via_SNP - what it does**
Liftover_via_SNP is a specialized alignment tool to find the location of large genome regions of interest from a source genome to another genome. The tool is specialized to lift over between the most recent builds of 4 published rice genomes (IR64, Azucena - https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-020-0438-2; N22 - https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-018-0040-0; Nipponbare - https://doi.org/10.1186/1939-8433-6-4)
It uses blat_ as alignment engine, and the output is blat PSL format (please read the blat manual for more information). The default parameters of blat should work fine for rice genomes.
This tool is useful to find a QTL or GWAS region flanked by 2 SNPs that was mapped from a source genome (example, in Nipponbare) in another rice genome (say, IR64). A common use case would be if your study used SNPs discovered from the Nipponbare (japonica) reference genome, but you are doing QTL mapping for a population from an indica cross. You can lift-over the region from the reference genome to the closely related indica genome (IR64) using this tool. To further refine the lift-over, use the **Blat_Alignment_Filter** tool.
.. _blat: http://users.soe.ucsc.edu/~kent/
